concept.title: view
concept.shortdesc: The view consists of several contextually organized sections to help you quickly make use of the most critical features without having to leave .

section.title: Toolbar
section.p: The toolbar indicates the currently selected branch and working copy and provides quick access to the most commonly used features. You can use the toolbar elements to check what branch you are currently on, clone a new repository, push and pull changes, change your current branch or working copy, and view the history of a branch or a file.

section.title: Staging area
section.p: The staging area is where you can keep track of all the changes on the current branch and decide which of those changes to include in your next commit. Each file listed in this area is supplied with an additional status icons to indicate the type of the change (addition, modification, or deletion).
Additionally, the staging area provides per-file context menu actions such as discarding changes, blame, comparison, and conflict resolution options.

section.title: Commit area
section.p: The commit area consists of a list of up to 7 previously used commit messages, a text box where you can enter a new commit message, and a button to commit your changes to the local repository.
